instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00923 no power
threads.message:
This board has no power and just randomly died according to customer. No liquid damage.

Meter is at 20v 0.15 amps. PPBUS is 13v. Tried DFU but cannot get the machine into DFU mode.

What should be checked next??

threads.title: 820-00923 no power
threads.message:
This is not T2 machine.

Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).

threads.title: 820-00923 no power
threads.message:
Yes 3.2v on  3V3_S5/SUS 

PM_PWRBTN_L is  3.3v and has a drop pulse when  SMC_ONOFF_L is triggered.

PCH side of CPU  is warm on thermal cam

threads.title: 820-00923 no power
threads.message:
Can you catch a pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L at same time?

If board stays in S5, PCH shouldn't heat at all.

threads.title: 820-00923 no power
threads.message:
PM_SLP_S4_L 3.4 but does not pulse when  SMC_ONOFF_L is triggered

Board has constant S5 voltage and PCH is warm

threads.title: 820-00923 no power
threads.message:
If PM_SLP_S4_L is steady high, then power on sequence is started.
All S3 voltages should be present, like 1.2V for RAM.
If also PM_SLP_S3_L is high, then check S0 voltages.

threads.title: 820-00923 no power
threads.message: PM_SLP_S3_L is high and all S0 rails appear to be present

threads.title: 820-00923 no power
threads.message:
Check for USB activity and external video.

What is CPU core voltage, after 10-15s?
PLT_RST_L goes high?

threads.title: 820-00923 no power
threads.message:
No usb activity or external video. Board is at 20v and a consistent 0.14amps

PLT_RST_L 0V

PPVCC_S0_CPU 0V

PPVCCIO_S0_CPU 0.950V

threads.title: 820-00923 no power
threads.message:
Also missing L7270 voltage?
You can try known good BIOS...

threads.title: 820-00923 no power
threads.message:
0V  L7270 

Bios from donar board did not make any differences

threads.title: 820-00923 no power
threads.message: Do you get voltages from pages 73, 75 and 76?
